channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Oyster farmer and veteran Graham Platner hopes his message lands with Maine voters
item.description: In Maine, oyster farmer and military veteran Graham Platner has become something of a phenomenon in his bid to topple Republican Sen. Susan Collins in next year's midterm election.
item.content:encoded: In Maine, oyster farmer and military veteran Graham Platner has become something of a phenomenon in his bid to topple Republican Sen. Susan Collins in next year's midterm election.
item.dc:creator: Steve Mistler

item.title: Singer-songwriter Madi Diaz is out with a new stripped-down album, 'Fatal Optimist'
item.description: Nashville singer-songwriter Madi Diaz is out with her new album. Fatal Optimist an introspective album that is her most stripped down, acoustic record to date.
item.content:encoded: Nashville singer-songwriter Madi Diaz is out with her new album. Fatal Optimist an introspective album that is her most stripped down, acoustic record to date.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Peru's president was impeached. Her replacement has also been plagued by scandal
item.description: Peru's Congress has ousted President Dina Boluarte for "moral incapacity," plunging the country's fragile democracy into deeper uncertainty.
item.content:encoded: Peru's Congress has ousted President Dina Boluarte for "moral incapacity," plunging the country's fragile democracy into deeper uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: Russian and French puppet shows were pushed off air after satirizing those in power
item.description: The creators of beloved political puppet shows in France and Russia feel déjà vu over the Jimmy Kimmel saga, as they recall being shut down for displeasing the powerful.
item.content:encoded: The creators of beloved political puppet shows in France and Russia feel déjà vu over the Jimmy Kimmel saga, as they recall being shut down for displeasing the powerful.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: First privately funded uranium enrichment plant in U.S. to be built in Kentucky
item.description: A California-based firm plans to build the first privately funded uranium enrichment plant in Kentucky amid efforts to bolster the country's domestic uranium enrichment.
item.content:encoded: A California-based firm plans to build the first privately funded uranium enrichment plant in Kentucky amid efforts to bolster the country's domestic uranium enrichment.
item.dc:creator: Derek Operle

item.title: Channing Tatum is utterly winning as a real-life robber in 'Roofman'
item.description: Channing Tatum plays a real-life robber who hid out in a Toys"R"Us in the new movie Roofman.
item.content:encoded: Channing Tatum plays a real-life robber who hid out in a Toys"R"Us in the new movie Roofman.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: Philadelphia pro is world champion of cheese
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with with Emilia D'Albero, the first American to win the title of "Best Cheesemonger in the World."
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with with Emilia D'Albero, the first American to win the title of "Best Cheesemonger in the World."
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Israeli forces pull back as Gaza ceasefire takes effect
item.description: Israeli forces have pulled back a line agreed in the Trump truce deal, allowing Hamas to start gathering hostages for release
item.content:encoded: Israeli forces have pulled back a line agreed in the Trump truce deal, allowing Hamas to start gathering hostages for release
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Venezuela's 'Iron Lady' wins Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: The 2025 Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to Venezuela's leading opposition figure, Maria Corina Machado. The 58-year old democracy leader has been in hiding since 2024.
item.content:encoded: The 2025 Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to Venezuela's leading opposition figure, Maria Corina Machado. The 58-year old democracy leader has been in hiding since 2024.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Trump blurs lines between illegal immigration and crime in National Guard deployments
item.description: As President Trump pushes to get National Guard troops patrolling American cities, his administration has, in effect, blurred the lines between traditional law enforcement and immigration enforcement.
item.content:encoded: As President Trump pushes to get National Guard troops patrolling American cities, his administration has, in effect, blurred the lines between traditional law enforcement and immigration enforcement.
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf
